DataElement.preferredName: Person Creatinine Urine Protein Measurement Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether the urine protein creatinine, the breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function as determined by of the amount of protein present in a urine sample, as element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Creatinine Urine Protein Measurement Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to urine protein creatinine, the breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function as determined by of the amount of protein present in a urine sample, as element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Creatinine Urine Protein Measurement Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.(NCI):The determination of the amount of protein present in a urine sample.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.
The determination of the amount of protein present in a urine sample.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: GOG CRF:Gynecologic Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is her urine protein creatini
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is her urine protein creatinine (UPC) ratio less than 1 (or urinary protein less than 1.0g/24 hours)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRf Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is urine protein creatinine (UPC) ratio less than 1 gm?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is urine protein creatinine (UPC) ratio less than or equal to 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's urine protein 0-1+ based on a sample tested for proteinuria by the dipstick method?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient's urine protein 0-1+ based on a sample tested for proteinuria by the dipstick method or urine protein creatinine (UPC) ratio less than 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have urine protein creatinine ratio (UPC) of less than or equal to 1 OR less than or equal to 2+ proteinuria on two consecutive dipsticks taken no less than 1 week apart?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Eligibility Ind-2 2018257v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
